text: Hacène Lalmas (12 March 1943 – 7 July 2018) was an Algerian footballer. He played as a midfielder and was nicknamed El Kebch (The Ram). Lalmas was born in Algiers, Algeria. He played for OM Ruisseau from 1954 to 1962, CR Belouizdad from 1962 to 1973, NA Hussein Dey from 1973 to 1975 and for Algeria national football team from 1963 to 1974. Lalmas died in Algiers on 7 July 2018 from an aortic dissection at the age of 75.Adieu à Hacene Lalmas, El Kebch légendaire du football algérien ==Club career== Although he started his career with OM Ruisseau, Lalmas played most of his career for CR Belouizdad and it was with CRB. He led the club to four league titles, three cup titles and three Maghreb Champions Cup titles. ==Career statistics== ===International=== :Scores and results list Algeria's goal tally first. "Score" column indicates the score after the player's goal. # Date Venue Opponent Score Result Competition 1\. 22 March 1964 Alexandria Stadium, Alexandria 1–1 2–2 Friendly 2\. 4 November 1964 Stade El Annasser, Algiers 2–1 2–2 Friendly 3\. 19 July 1965 Stade Alphonse Massemba-Débat, Brazzaville 1–0 1–0 1965 All-Africa Games 4\. 5 February 1967 Stade Modibo Kéïta, Bamako 0–2 0–3 1968 African Cup of Nations qualification 5\. 12 February 1967 Stade Municipal, Ouagadougou 1–2 1–2 1968 African Cup of Nations qualification 6\. 12 September 1967 Stade Chedli Zouiten, Tunis 0–2 1–3 1967 Mediterranean Games 7\. 14 January 1968 Hailé Sélassié Stadium, Addis Ababa 1–0 4–0 1968 African Cup of Nations 8\. 14 January 1968 Hailé Sélassié Stadium, Addis Ababa 2–0 4–0 1968 African Cup of Nations 9\. 14 January 1968 Hailé Sélassié Stadium, Addis Ababa 3–0 4–0 1968 African Cup of Nations 10\. 26 June 1968 Stade Mohamed V, Casablanca 1–0 2–2 1968 Olympic Games Qualifiers 11\. 26 June 1968 Stade Mohamed V, Casablanca 2–2 2–2 1968 Olympic Games Qualifiers 12\. 30 June 1968 Stade Mohamed V, Casablanca 1–0 2–3 1968 Olympic Games Qualifiers 13\. 18 December 1968 Stade El Annasser, Algiers – 2–5 Friendly 14\. 25 December 1969 Stade El Annasser, Algiers 1–0 3–1 ==Honours== CR Belouizdad * Algerian league: 1965, 1966, 1970, 1971 * Algerian Cup: 1966, 1969, 1970 * Maghreb Champions Cup: 1970, 1971, 1972 Individual * Algerian league top scorer: 1969–70 ==References== ==Other websites== * Hacene LALMAS Category:1943 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from aortic dissection Category:Footballers from Algiers
title: Hacène Lalmas
